thread.title: Early Bengals practice report: Gilberry only player not going
thread.title_full: Early Bengals practice report: Gilberry only player not going

title: Early Bengals practice report: Gilberry only player not going
text:
Early Bengals practice report: Gilberry only player not going 
Updated: Thu, Oct 08 2015, 03:16 PM 
CINCINNATI (Richard Skinner) -- Defensive lineman Wallace Gilberry appeared to be the only member of the Bengals 53-man roster not practicing in some capacity on Thursday. 
The Bengals (4-0) will face the Seattle Seahawks (2-2) this Sunday at 1 p.m. in Paul Brown Stadium. 
Gilberry didn't practice on Wednesday due to a calf injury. He did take part in pre-practice stretching and warm-up and then was seen riding a stationary bike during the 30 minutes practice is open to the media. 
It appeared cornerback Adam Jones was going to practice in some capacity as he had his helmet and shoulder pads. Jones, who missed Wednesday's practice due to a groin injury that caused him to miss almost the entire second half of last Sunday's win over Kansas City, will likely be a limited participant. 
Offensive tackle Andrew Whitworth was also back at practice after being given a veteran's day off on Wednesday. 
The four players who were listed as limited participants on Wednesday also were practicing in some capacity on Thursday as well: safety George Iloka, who didn't play against Kansas City due to an ankle injury; defensive back Leon Hall (non-injury related); running back Jeremy Hill (knee) and safety Reggie Nelson (hamstring). 
The Bengals will release the official practice participation report shortly after practice ends around 1:15 p.m.
